DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Radiation Therapy Breast Head and Neck Skin No Cancer Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-4
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a person has received a prior administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target by radiation, to the breast, head and neck, the area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas, or skin, and is free of progression, a pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Radiation Therapy Breast Head and Neck Skin No Cancer Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a received a prior administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target by radiation, to the breast, head and neck, the area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas, or skin, and is free of progression, a pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Radiation Therapy Breast Head and Neck Skin No Cancer Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was the prior radiation for l
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the prior radiation for localized cancer of the breast, head and neck or skin completed more than 3 years prior to registration and does the patient remain free of recurrent or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior radiation for localized cancer of the breast, head and neck, thyroid, or skin completed more than 5 years prior to registration and has the patient remained free of recurrent or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, was it completed more than 3 years prior to registration and does the patient remain free of recurrent or metastatic disease?
